title: Orchid & Houseplants Pest Control Made Easy  DIY Garlic-Infused Alcohol Solution #ninjaorchids

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a garlic-based insecticide and fungicide solution to protect orchids from pests.
subtasks: Collect and prepare five garlic cloves.
Chop the garlic into small pieces for the solution.
Measure 100 milliliters of RO water and 70% isopropyl alcohol (start with water, then add alcohol to reach proper concentration).
Combine the garlic and water in a spray bottle, letting it marinate for at least 24 hours in the refrigerator.
Strain the garlic from the insecticide solution before use.
Apply the garlic solution to the orchids, focusing on the undersides of leaves and affected areas.

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a ground garlic fungicide solution.
subtasks: Measure 1/8 cup of ground garlic and 1/2 liter (or equivalent) of RO water.
Allow the ground garlic and water mixture to steep for 24 hours in a sealed container, stored in the refrigerator.
Strain the fungicide solution after steeping.
Use the strained solution to treat any fungal issues on the orchids.
Monitor the orchids for effectiveness of the treatments and log progress in the comments.
